nodes.bodyText: Just call this "hubConfig", as "adminConfig" implies it's an admin user.
Initially, I thought I needed to get runAsAdmin(), so had it named 'adminConfig' but later realized I could do it as developer, but forgot to rename it. Will do
Does this break on the nightly?
Yes, it breaks in today's nightly build
You can use "sleep" in the parent class so you don't have to deal with InterruptedException.

Also, let's get this all into a separate method called "waitForReindexingToFinish". And limit the sleep to maybe 500ms or so - the call to check on it is extremely fast, so we want this loop to finish as soon as the reindexer is done.
For consistency, can you name this "RunFlowWithStemmingEnabledTest"?

Should this go to develop or 5.4-develop - is there any benefit having it on develop?
If you go to 5.4-develop, you can use the runFlow method that handles everything for you. Actually, that's on develop too.
In any case, don't use Autowired here - that can causes problems with parallel tests since FlowRunnerImpl isn't a thread-safe class.
Just curious, shouldn't a data-hub-developer be able to do this?

assertTrue/False should really only be used when you're testing against a boolean variable. The problem is that if this fails, you don't see what the two values are.
When you're not sure about case, just lowercase both, though you don't need to do that since JobStatus is already lowercased - so e.g. assertEquals(JobStatus.STOP_ON_ERROR.toString(), resp.getJobStatus().toLowerCase())

If this is reliable, I think it's a good thing to move up to AbstractHubTest. But for consistency, do "Reindex" instead of "ReIndex", as ML treats it as one word.
I'm also going to open a ticket for this in ml-app-deployer, this would be a nice feature to have in there - e.g. new Database(...).waitForReindex().

I believe there's an issue here in that if the version of ML isn't supported, then the call to set stemmed searches to "off" won't be executed. So I'd just move this to the test.
In fact, I think private methods can make this read nicely:

enableAdvancedStemming();
run the flow and verify an error occurs (I think it'd be good to assert on the contents of stepOutput too, as we can verify there are words in there indicating that a step definition was not found)
reindexDatabase()
run the flow again and verify it succeeds
I think moving assumeTrue(new Versions(getHubConfig()).getMLVersion().getMajor() >= 10);  to the first line of setupEach () should resolve that issue right ?
Since you only have the one test method, I think it's simpler to just put everything in that method. But if you want to keep the BeforeEach method, then I think assumeTrue will do the trick there.
The test keeps failing in the pipeline even though it passed in my local. I am increasing the sleep time to see of if the test passes. I will then work to see why the query isn't reliable.

You could try running this as a little main program (not the test itself, just this code - we don't want to clear the database) against the HC nightly index, just to test against an ML instance that isn't running on your laptop. I recommend checking with the DB team too to see if there's a recommended script for checking to see if the database is reindexing or not.
